intro: Hemigraphis junghuhniana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or red leaf plant, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage with deep green to reddish hues on the upper and lower surfaces. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Hemigraphis junghuhniana is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is known for its aromatic leaves.
